intro: Verbascum pseudodigitalis var. pseudodigitalis, commonly known as the desert mullein, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and tall, erect flowering stems. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and nectar for various wildlife species.
